identificationModule.briefTitle: The Feasibility Study of Dual-Section Nasogastric Tube
identificationModule.officialTitle: The Feasibility Study of Dual-Section Nasogastric Tube in Dysphagia Patients

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this studyis to assess the feasibility and safety of novel designed two-piece nasogastric tube.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Participants with Adverse Events
primaryOutcomes.description: monitor the adverse events like pressure sore, numbers of self-extubation, dislocation of tube, or other unpredictable events.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 1 weeks

secondaryOutcomes.description: using Likert scale for overall satisfaction
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 1 weeks

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* dysphagia
* mouth neoplasms
* stroke
* already use conventional nasogastric tube for at least 2 weeks

Exclusion Criteria:

* unconsciousness patient
* unstable medical condition with needs of closely medical care
* unable to fill in inform consent
* the fixed length was less than 50 or more than 60 centimeter when using conventional nasogastric tube
